intro: Cleisostoma cristatum, commonly known as the crested cleisostoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, crested leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant. Due to its ornamental value, it is also sometimes collected for horticultural purposes.
